Title: Dawson trial to go ahead after application for permanent stay rejected
Summary: Chris Dawson is accused of murdering his wife Lynette, who disappeared in 1982. He has pleaded not guilty.

Title: Sydney GP has shown 'no remorse' for assaulting sleeping women: court
Summary: Ali Khorami was found guilty of indecently assaulting multiple women who attended a Glebe clinic for sleep studies in 2018.

Title: Man charged with attack on police found dead in prison cell
Summary: Frederick Fadi Elrezz had been in custody since September 2, when he allegedly attacked a group of three police officers in Sydney's CBD, slashing one in the head and shoulder with a knife.

Title: Shore challenges won't earn you entry to adult world
Summary: Is it bad that I am not surprised when I read the Triwizard Shornament challenge book? Is it even worse that I understand it?

Title: Crashed car focus of investigation into 'targeted' fatal stabbing
Summary: Police believe the events leading up to a black car crashing into a creek in western Sydney could help them understand why a man was fatally stabbed nearby.

Title: Abdul Abu-Mahmoud guilty of ordering Brayden Dillon revenge execution
Summary: Brayden, 15, was shot dead in his bed in Sydney's south-west in April 2017. He was targeted in revenge for the perceived actions of his brother.

Title: McNamara claims Rogerson admitted prior murders before Jamie Gao killing
Summary: Both former detectives are appealing against their 2016 convictions and life sentences for the murder of the drug dealing student in a Padstow storage unit.

Title: Man charged in Bathurst over alleged importation of firearms
Summary: Robert Bettles was charged with possessing an unregistered firearm, not keeping the firearm safely, possessing ammunition without having a licence or permit or authority, and possessing or using a prohibited weapon without a permit.

Title: Psychologist suspected John Edwards could be dangerous, inquest hears
Summary: The psychologist says she told Jack and Jennifer Edwards' court-appointed lawyer she thought their father was a potentially dangerous narcissist.

Title: Crucial evidence about gun and corrupt cop not heard by jury, court told
Summary: A suppression order has been lifted in the Supreme Court appeal by former detectives Glen McNamara and Roger Rogerson to overturn their murder convictions.
